body: Susan Wagner High of Staten Island won its third consecutive Public Schools Athletic League football title yesterday with a 20-0 victory over Lincoln of Brooklyn. The triumph extended the Falcons' winning streak to 37 games, the longest active streak in New York State. The game, before a crowd of about 2,500 at Midwood Field in Brooklyn, featured
title: SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Susan Wagner Takes 3d Straight Title

body: Hoping to prevent the violence and vandalism that have marred recent Halloweens in New York City, the police have assigned extra officers to patrol around schools and shopping areas today, and special units will be watching for roving bands of youths like those who rampaged through the city's streets last year. title: Police and Schools Try to Head Off Halloween Trouble

body: LEAD: There was no final ceremony for Donald E. Moore, who retired Saturday after 10 years as president of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. There was no final ceremony for Donald E. Moore, who retired Saturday after 10 years as president of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. But to some admirers, an eloquent testimonial are the 10,000 visitors who travel to
title: Botanic Garden Loses a Leader, Gains a Legacy

body: LEAD: While Nelson Mandela's visit may have been a special celebration for black New Yorkers, some whites in middle-class neighborhoods far from the throngs watched his triumphal tour with the sense that it was not really their party, and described the guest of honor with a mix of admiration, wariness of his intent and, occasionally, hostility.
title: The Mandela Visit; Not All Felt Invited to Mandela's Party

body: LEAD: FOR two weeks every year, the quality of play at the National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows, Queens, is raised to levels not usually encountered on the well-kept public courts; athletes struggle in summer heat and searing jet noise. And, at tournament's end, champions emerge and trophies are distributed. FOR two weeks every year, the
title: ON YOUR OWN; Youth Is Served in Vast Tennis Tournament

body: LEAD: Transit Authority officials say New Yorkers are all but certain to face further cuts in city bus service. The cuts will compound those the Transit Authority has made over the last four years, when shrinking ridership caused the agency to eliminate 10 major bus routes and revise service on virtually all the remaining 198. Transit Authority
title: Expect Fewer Buses and Passengers, Transit Authority Warns

body: LEAD: Brownstone and limestone houses built in the 19th and early 20th centuries are featured in a house tour on Sunday in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Prospect-Lefferts Gardens. The tour, the 21st sponsored by the neighborhood association, will run from noon to 5 P.M. Tickets - $7 in advance, $8 on the day - are on sale at the association's
title: House Tour in Brooklyn

title: Subway Police Patrols for Students to Begin

body: LEAD: On the block where he lives, the accused youth is known as a bully with a vicious streak - a boy who taunted and beat smaller children, stole their lunch money and other property and sometimes whipped stray dogs into snarling fury and set them on one another for the fun of it. title: Youth Held in Burning of Boy Called Thuggish but Lonely

body: LEAD: An 11-year-old Brooklyn boy was abducted on his way to school yesterday morning, taken to a dingy garage, beaten, bound and finally set on fire by another youth who tried force him to smoke crack, the police said. title: Boy, 13, Arrested in Burning of 11-Year-Old

body: LEAD: GOLF Couples Wins Los Angeles Open: Fred Couples lost the lead with his only bogey of the round on the ninth hole, then took charge with three birdies down the stretch to win the Los Angeles Open yesterday. Couples, winning for the first time since 1987, shot a final-round two-under-par 69 at Riviera Country Club, good for an 18-under-par 266
title: RESULTS PLUS

body: LEAD: In a voice choked with emotion, a Brooklyn mother told a City Hall hearing yesterday that when she sends her children to school by public transportation each morning, she worries she will not see them alive again because of marauding groups of violent youths. title: A Panel Hears Tales of Fears and 'Wilding'
